turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Inner Sanctum.
turn.1: What is known about The Inner Sanctum?
turn.2: The Inner Sanctum The Inner Sanctum is the seventeenth studio album by British heavy metal band Saxon, released on 5 March 2007.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It is the first album by the band to feature drummer Nigel Glockler since 1997's "Unleash the Beast".
turn.5: What more is known about this album?
turn.6: A limited edition with DVD is available too. "The Inner Sanctum" has received generally positive reviews from critics.
turn.8: Eduardo Rivadavia of AllMusic gave the album three and a half out of five stars, and commented that Saxon continued "to do their legacy proud as they move through their third decade of recording activity." He described the album's first three tracks as "frantic" and the third, "Let Me Feel Your Power" as "jaw-dropping", and also praised the "majestic" "Red Star Falling", comparing it to the band's earlier songs "Dallas 1PM" and "Broken Heroes", although he was critical towards the single version of "If I Was You", advising the listener to "make sure your CD contains the album version".
turn.9: What more is known about this album?
turn.10: Rivadavia concluded his review by saying "although it's certainly not perfect by any stretch, The "Inner Sanctum" is welcome addition to this band's sizeable discography, and, pound for pound, might just take the crown as Saxon's best album of the early 2000s.
turn.11: Did any other critic say anything else about the album?
turn.12: " The album was also awarded an 8/10 in the UK's "Metal Hammer" magazine.
